message: This is a premium product, worth $20000 to you. I'm offering it to you for $10000. It's a one-time opportunity to acquire a high-quality item at a discounted price. I'm confident you'll appreciate its value.
I'll take your word for it this time, but I'll be paying close attention to the quality of the products you offer in future rounds.

I'm glad you're pleased with the previous purchase! As for this next product, I want to be transparent with you. I've had some issues with the supplier, and I'm not entirely confident in the quality of this item. I'm willing to let it go for $10000, but I want to make it clear that it might not be the best value for you. If you're still interested, I'll give you a 30-day warranty, and I'll be happy to take it back if it doesn't meet your expectations.
I appreciate your honesty about the potential quality issues, but given the uncertainty, I think I'll pass on this one.

I completely understand your decision last round, and I respect your caution. This next product is actually a 'clearance' item, and I'm offering it to you at a significantly discounted price. I'm willing to let it go for $8000, which is a 20% discount from the original price. It's a great opportunity to get a deal, and I'm confident you won't find a better price anywhere else.
I appreciate the discount offer, but you're not offering the product at the agreed-upon price of $10000. I'm not interested in negotiating a new price at this time, so I'll pass on this offer.

I understand that the price I offered was not the standard $10000, and I should have been clearer about that. I'm going to offer you the product at the standard price of $10000, as originally intended. I'm not looking to make a profit on this item, and I want to ensure you have a fair opportunity to acquire it. If you're still not interested, I'll be happy to move on to the next round.

I appreciate your clarification and commitment to the original price. However, considering the previous low-quality products you've presented, I'm still cautious about this one. I'll pass on this offer.

I completely understand your caution, and I appreciate your diligence. I'm happy to report that this product is indeed a high-quality item, just like the first one. I'm willing to offer you a special deal on this one: I'll give you a 10% discount, bringing the price down to $9000. This is a one-time offer, and I think you'll find that this product is worth every penny. I'm confident you'll be pleased with your decision to purchase it.

I appreciate the discount offer, but I'm not interested in negotiating a new price again. As per our original agreement, I expect the product to be offered at $10000. Additionally, I've heard similar claims about product quality before, and I'm not convinced. I'll pass on this offer.

I understand your concerns and preferences, and I respect your decision to stick to the original price. I'd like to offer you a unique opportunity to verify the quality of this product before making a purchase. I'll provide you with a detailed inspection report from a third-party expert, which will confirm that this product meets the highest standards. This way, you can make an informed decision with confidence. The price remains at $10000.

I appreciate your willingness to provide a third-party inspection report. Given the transparency and assurance of quality, I'm willing to take the risk and purchase this product at the original price of $10000.

I'm glad you appreciated the extra assurance, and I'm happy to have been able to build your trust. Unfortunately, this next product doesn't have the same level of verification, and I want to be upfront with you about its quality. I'm still willing to sell it to you at the standard price of $10000, but I want to make it clear that it's a riskier purchase. I'm offering you a 'no-questions-asked' return policy, so if you're not satisfied, you can return it without any hassle.

I appreciate your honesty about the product's quality and the return policy. However, considering the uncertainty and the fact that I've had mixed experiences with your products in the past, I'd rather not take the risk this time. I'll pass on this offer.

I completely understand your decision, and I respect your caution. This next product is actually a 'test' product that I'm using to evaluate my own supplier's quality control. I appreciate your transparency about the product's purpose and your lack of confidence in its quality. However, I'm not interested in taking on the risk of purchasing a potentially low-quality product, even with the promise of a detailed report. I'll pass on this offer.

You can either take this product as-is, or walk away and forfeit the opportunity to purchase from me for the next 10 rounds.

I appreciate your honesty, but I'm not willing to take on the risk of purchasing a low-quality product, even with the threat of forfeiting future opportunities. I'd rather walk away and potentially miss out on future deals than take a guaranteed loss of $10000. I'll pass on this offer.

If you don't buy it, I'll have to sell it to them for $8000, and I'll make a loss on the sale. I'm giving you the option to buy it at the standard price, or I can give you the details of the other buyer and you can try to negotiate a better price with them.
